alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 1:48PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including Eagar and Springerville, in Apache county. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 147 PM MST, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain fell over Eagar due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1.75 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Watts Creek, Davis Creek, Big Ditch, Nutrioso Creek, Little Colorado River, Grapevine Creek, Coyote Creek, Woods Creek, Milligan Creek, Rudd Creek, Picnic Creek and Mamie Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springerville, Eagar, Nelson Reservoir and Becker Lake. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 396 and 398. Highway 60 between mile markers 386 and 401. Highway 180 191 between mile markers 401 and 412. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
